results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

results.title: Mr Reliable: a true story
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Michael Hamlyn, Terry Hayes, Jim McElroy, State of Queensland, Hayes McElroy Productions, PolyGram Filmproduktion and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: In 1968, petty criminal Wally Melish (Colin Friels), earns himself the reputation of folk hero when he finds himself embroiled in an eight day siege with his girlfriend Beryl (Jacqueline McKenzie), after the police mistakenly think he has taken her hostage. The siege is marked by a marriage (between Wally and Beryl), and the media circus which captures the days events on national television. Based on a real event, cast includes Geoff Merrell, Neil Fitzpatrick, Lisa Hensley, Barry Otto and Paul Sonkkila.

results.title: Labyrinth of passion = Laberinto de pasiones
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar and Alphaville S A
results.brief_description: Almodovar has taken the setting of Madrid as the centrepoint for this labyrinth of love, lust and passion. Sexilla the sex fiend is in love with Riza Niro, heir to a fallen Arab empire. Riza’s preoccupations are men and cosmetics. Set against a city of music, persecution, obsession and uncertain futures. Cast includes Antonio Banderas, Ceilia Roth, Imanol Arias and Fernando Vivanco. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Frankenstein's Great-aunt Tillie
results.creator_credit: Myron J. Gold and Tillie Productions
results.brief_description: Comical farce about descendants of Frankenstein’s creator returning to the town of Mucklefugger to live at their unclaimed estate. Aunt Tillie helps the wayward women of the town save their home; the Cradle, rebelling also against unscrupulous and incompetent town officials who endeavour to take over their estate. Accompanied by two lusty side-kicks, the film barely holds together with plot, digressing into many directions at times. Be warned, this is a silly movie. Cast includes Donald Pleasance, Yvonne Furneaux, Zsa Zsa Gabor and Miguel Angel Fuentes. WARNING: THE PICTURE JUMPS AT THE BEGINNING AND THERE IS SOME DROPOUT.

results.title: Live flesh = Carne tremula
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Agustin Almodovar, France 3, CiBy 2000 and El Deseo S. A.
results.brief_description: Several lives are forever altered by a single gun shot. Wealthy heiress and drug addict Helena (Francesca Neri), is awaiting her drug dealer when she accidentally allows in her apartment Victor (Liberto Rabal), to whom she vaguely promised a date. In the confusion that ensues, two cops, David (Javier Bardem) and Sancho (Jose Sancho) arrive and a gun goes off. Four years later, Victor comes out of jail and goes looking for Helena who is now married to paraplegic David and runs a children’s shelter. Victor’s desire for vengeance is temporarily sidetracked when he meets Clara (Angela Molina), an attractive, unhappily married older woman, keen to assist Victor in his other ultimate goal in life - to become the world’s best lover! Departing from his usual camp style Almodovar’s foray into film noir weaves a web of guilty pleasures, unbridled passions and not-so-sweet revenge mixed with subtle references to Bunuel. Adapted from “Live Flesh” by Ruth Rendell. In Spanish with English sub-titles.

results.title: Venetian bird = The Assassin
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: A private detective, Edward Mercer (Richard Todd) is hired by a French insurance company to help locate an Italian they wish to reward for the role he played in the rescue of an Allied airman shot down in Venice during the war. On his mission Mercer discovers mysterious secret exits in the houses of the city, all leading to a maze of canals and alleyways. To complicate matters he is implicated as a murderer and it looks like he has been set up by the man he is seeking. Mercer’s quest culminates in a chase across the rooftops of Venice. Cast includes Richard Todd, Eva Bartok, John Gregson, George Coulouris and Sidney James.

results.title: The Quiller memorandum
results.creator_credit: Michael Anderson, Ivan Foxwell and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: George Segal stars as British intelligence agent Quiller. His mission is to investigate a Neo Nazi organisation located in Berlin and headed by a ruthless fanatic, Oktober (Max von Sydow). It is mission fraught with danger, as Quiller is informed by his boss Pol (Alec Guinness), that two other agents have already lost their lives. It is for this reason that Pol does not send the protection of agents Weng (Robert Helpmann) and Hengel (Peter Carsten), and Quiller quickly finds himself the prisoner of Oktober. With no-one to help him, Quiller must place his trust in a beautiful school teacher Inge (Senta Berger), and utilise all the skills he has been taught if he is to escape. Based on the novel “The Berlin memorandum” by Adam Hall (Elleston Trevor). Screenplay by Harold Pinter.

results.title: The Ipcress file
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Sidney J. Furie, Harry Saltzman and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description: Based on Len Deighton’s bestseller and produced by Bond films’ Harry Saltzman, this video will be a welcome addition to fans of the world of spies and espionage. Michael Caine stars as British espionage agent Harry Palmer, a cynical and rebellious ex-Army sergeant who has been blackmailed into working for Britain’s secret service. He finds himself caught up in The Ipcress File, a horrifying conspiracy that involves brainwashing, murder, treachery, and implicates involvement at the highest level; M5. Cast includes Michael Caine, Nigel Green, Guy Doleman, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Aubrey Richards.

results.title: One fine day (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Lynda Obst and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An unlikely romance develops when two single parents share babysitting for a day. Melanie (Michelle Pfeiffer), is a single mother with a busy career as an architect. Jack (George Clooney), is a commitment-shy newspaper columnist who has access to his daughter on the weekends, although his ex-wife’s sudden elopement has Jack looking after his daughter during the week. When their children miss the boat for a class field trip, Jack and Melanie agree to share babysitting shifts, leading to a day of interesting and romantic developments as they struggle with their day to day work, the children, and the feelings that are developing between them. Cast includes Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman and Charles Durning.
